title: Drawing, "Drawing for Hemmerle Bracelet", 2012
medium: Graphite, black ball point ink, crayon on off-white wove paper
description: Drawing of a pockwood, oxodized silver, white gold, turquoise, and tsavorites bangle bracelet.  Part of Egyptian revival collection.
justification: In 2006, Stefan Hemmerle traveled with his wife Sylveli, his son Christian, and his daughter-in-law Yasmin to Egypt, where Yasmin was born.&nbsp; The family’s experience of the country proved deeply inspiring to them all.&nbsp; A private tour of the Cairo Museum, where Stefan was able to intimately view ancient artifacts, was a creative revelation.&nbsp; The seductive simplicity of line that transcended thousands of years and the amuletic power of Egyptian jewels formed the basis for a series of new designs, including the Egyptian Story Harmony Bangle Bracelet that has been offered to the Museum.&nbsp; This drawing, executed by Hemmerle staff, provides a stunning illustration with graphite and crayon of the striations echoed throughout the Bangle.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Drawing for Hemmerle Bracelet", 2012.Graphite, black ball point ink, crayon on off-white wove paper. Gift of Hemmerle. 2012-23-4.
